title: Voyages to Antiquity steers a new course
text:
Voyages to Antiquity steers a new course 2 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Voyages to Antiquity is renewing its commitment to the trade as it moves away from the eastern Mediterranean and even prepares to visit the UK 
New managing director Jos Dewing said recent geopolitical incidents had forced the cruise line to pull out of many of its original destinations in recent years. 
However, he added the move has allowed the company to rethink not only its itineraries but also the way it markets itself to the trade. 
Dewing said: “The original focus was around the eastern Mediterranean going to destinations that people thought were not necessarily on the main travel map, such as Syria, the Crimea, Libya and Egypt. 
“All those key places were very much part of the original product and we can’t go there now.” 
Instead, he said the ship was being located more around destinations including Italy, Turkey, Greece and Sicily, adding 2016 would see Voyages’ sole ship, Aegean Odyssey, which has capacity for up to 405 passengers but typically sails with about 350, make its inaugural visit to the UK. 
Dewing, who replaced former boss David Yellow on May 1, said: “We’ll come up to Dover and Falmouth with visits. Our passengers wanted to see Aegean Odyssey in those areas and the likelihood is we’ll look at doing more with the UK.” 
He added this could mean operating ex-UK departures in 2017, although he denied the ship would ever be based in the country for long. 
“It is not the kind of product where we would base the ship in the UK. It is not a market we’re looking to compete with and we’re not going to be going to the fjords or the Baltic Sea,” Dewing said. 
He added the operator was looking to engage more with the trade having recruited 10 new members of staff in sales, marketing and product to join the 16-strong team currently working in the Oxford office. 
Voyages has also relaunched its agent website, complete with extra training, with those who complete it earning the opportunity to go on fam trips as well as additional commission payments.
